20110112190753.000|20110112190754.000|CC1|GET HIT THE HARDEST.

20110112190755.000|20110112190757.000|CC1|OF MASSACHUSETTS WERE UNDER A   
20110112190757.000|20110112190758.000|CC1|SNOW EMERGENCY.                 
20110112190758.000|20110112190800.000|CC1|NEW YORK CITY, CLEANUP EFFORTS  
20110112190800.000|20110112190802.000|CC1|WERE NOTABLY BETTER COORDINATED 
20110112190802.000|20110112190804.000|CC1|THAN AFTER LAST MONTH'S         
20110112190804.000|20110112190805.000|CC1|BLIZZARD.                       
20110112190805.000|20110112190806.000|CC1|PLOWS WERE PREPOSITIONED AND    
20110112190806.000|20110112190807.000|CC1|WORKERS AND EQUIPMENT WERE      
20110112190807.000|20110112190809.000|CC1|CONTRACTED AHEAD OF TIME.       
20110112190809.000|20110112190811.000|CC1|>> BY MIDWAY WE EXPECT          
20110112190811.000|20110112190813.000|CC1|EVERYTHING IN THE CITY WILL     
20110112190813.000|20110112190816.000|CC1|HAVE ONE PASS OF A PLOW.        
20110112190816.000|20110112190817.000|CC1|>> Reporter: PHILADELPHIA       
20110112190817.000|20110112190819.000|CC1|RECEIVED ONLY FIVE INCHES OF    
20110112190819.000|20110112190821.000|CC1|SNOW BUT ICY ROADS KEPT DRIVERS 
20110112190821.000|20110112190822.000|CC1|ON ALERT.                       
20110112190822.000|20110112190823.000|CC1|LOCAL OFFICIALS IN SEVERAL      
20110112190823.000|20110112190825.000|CC1|STATES RECOMMENDED THAT FOLKS   
20110112190825.000|20110112190826.000|CC1|STAY AT HOME IF POSSIBLE.       
20110112190826.000|20110112190828.000|CC1|>> KEEPING PEOPLE OFF THE ROADS 
20110112190828.000|20110112190830.000|CC1|ALLOWS THE PLOWS TO DO THEIR    
20110112190830.000|20110112190830.000|CC1|JOBS.                           
20110112190830.000|20110112190833.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THE SAME STORE     
20110112190833.000|20110112190834.000|CC1|CRIPPLED THE SOUTHERN STATES
